channel.title: Is there any type of cd with like 4gb on it?
channel.description: tryin to burn this huge iso from my friend's cd but its like 3.5 gb, is there a cd that can hold that much?

item.title: Is there any type of cd with like 4gb on it?
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:16, topic:141369”][quote author=bowserjr2 link=topic=193592.msg1741401#msg1741401 date=1189298417]
Here the cost 50 dvds for 12.5 Euro/99 NOK in fact cheaper than normal Cds.
And the Taxes are 25%.
[/quote]

How much are normal cd’s then? And you need to learn not to be impatient when quoting.[/quote]
The same price per disk, but then you must buy twice as much CDs.
But for 50 CDs the cost 17,55 euro.

Read full topic

item.title: Is there any type of cd with like 4gb on it?
item.dc:creator: @maru maru
item.description:
@maru wrote:

When I was at high school, I used to burn pirated movies for £5 ($10) each and albums for £3 ($6) each and I made a fortune from it.

item.title: Is there any type of cd with like 4gb on it?
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

Eh Pretty Easy:

If your income per year is 100,000 you’d have to pay 22,000 taxes. Fucking shit country.

In America, you have to pay roughly 50% taxes.

Read full topic
item.source: Is there any type of cd with like 4gb on it?

item.title: Is there any type of cd with like 4gb on it?
item.dc:creator: @Eh_Pretty_Easy Eh Pretty Easy
item.description:
@Eh_Pretty_Easy wrote:

Yeah, Finland lives off of taxes. If a shop sells something for 1euro, they have to pay 22% taxes, so the shop only makes 78cents, that goes for EVERYTHING. If your income per year is 100,000 you’d have to pay 22,000 taxes. Fucking shit country.

[quote=“FastBawlz, post:10, topic:141369”][quote author=Eh Pretty Easy link=topic=193592.msg1740252#msg1740252 date=1189279703]
Well, this shop near me sells 10 of them for 10,90 euros, and 50 for 59 euros.
[/quote]

What a rip off…[/quote]Yeah I meant DVD’s, the normal cd’s are 4,90 per 10.

Read full topic

@exe626 wrote:

I thought you buy packs of cd’s for more than 4gb?
[/quote]Maximum capacity that a normal CD-R/RW can hold is 700mb iirc. You use the cd’s for different things, like you download Ubuntu, burn it on one cd and then you download WinXp and burn it on another cd.[/quote]I that so? and what does one of these particular CD’s cost?

item.title: Is there any type of cd with like 4gb on it?

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:4, topic:141369”][quote author=blah bah7 link=topic=193592.msg1740017#msg1740017 date=1189276403]
ya, i googled it and found it but thanks anyway
[/quote]

Uh, what the hell did you find? There is no cd that can hold 3.5 gb.[/quote]

DVD’s can hold 4.7GB, and I usually call DVD’s cd’s. :\
